com.facebook.lifecycle

Interface ShutdownManager<T extends Comparable>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ShutdownManagerImpl

    public interface ShutdownManager<T extends Comparable>
    allows for objects to register shutdown hooks used instead of direct shutdown hooks in order to manage the order they are called The idea here is that on startup, we register the Thread this provides as a hook in case the JVM is killed. If the fb303.shutdown() is called, this will execute and remove itself from the jvm shutdown hooks

      • tryAddShutdownHook

        boolean tryAddShutdownHook(T stage,
                         Runnable hook)
        attempt to add a shutdown hook to be run at shutdown
        Parameters:
        stage - - stage to add the hook to
        hook - - hook to run
        Returns:
        true if the hook was added, false if we are already shutting down and the hook was not added

                   Runnable hook)
        add a hook to a given stage
        Parameters:
        stage - - stage to add the hook to
        hook - - hook to run
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if shutdown has started and we have passed the specified stage.
